description.en: This lecture series will start with some basic forensic principles that underpin the use of analytical chemistry in the court room. It will then develop to cover key biological samples that can be encountered in a forensic investigation along with their specific uses and pre-cautions that need to be taken during collection, storage, analysis and reporting of these sample types. A significant amount of time will be devoted to understanding the ethical considerations around forensic analysis and how other regulation can affect an investigation. The final part of this series will focus on some future directions in food fraud detection using metabonomic profiling.
description.et: Kursus hõlmab kohtuekspertiisi põhiprintsiipe, mis toetavad analüütilise keemia kasutamist kohtusaalis. Kursuses tuuakse välja peamised bioloogilised proovid, mida kohtumeditsiinilises uurimises võib kohata, koos nende konkreetsete kasutusalade ja ettevaatusabinõudega, mida tuleb rakendada nende proovitüüpide kogumisel, säilitamisel, analüüsimisel ja aruandlusel. Märkimisväärne aeg pühendatakse kohtuekspertiisi eetiliste kaalutluste mõistmisele ja sellele, kuidas muud regulatsioonid võivad uurimist mõjutada. Kursuse viimane osa keskendub mõnele tulevasele suunale toidupettuste avastamisel metabonoomilise profileerimise abil.

objectives.en: The overall objective of this course is to understand the forensic process and how it affects the analysis and reporting of the data obtained.
objectives.et: Kursuse üldeesmärk on mõista kohtuekspertiisi protsessi ja seda, kuidas see mõjutab saadud andmete analüüsi ja aruandlust.

learning_outcomes.en: The student who passes the course:
--- understands the sample collection on the crime scene;
learning_outcomes.et: --- saab aru, kuidas koguda proove kuriteopaigal;

learning_outcomes.en: --- appreciates the chain of custody requirements;
--- has knowledge of common forensic samples and specific issues with their retention;
learning_outcomes.et: --- omab teadmisi kohtuekspertiisi proovidest ja nende säilitamisega seotud konkreetsetest probleemidest;

learning_outcomes.en: --- understands the QA requirements in forensic analysis;
learning_outcomes.et: --- mõistab kohtuekspertiisi-alase analüüsi kvaliteedi tagamise nõudeid;

learning_outcomes.en: --- has an overview of the UK legal system;
--- understands the level of proof required for different cases,
learning_outcomes.et: --- saab aru erinevatel juhtudel nõutava tõendi tasemetest,

learning_outcomes.en: --- understands why we need expert witnesses;
learning_outcomes.et: --- saab aru, miks on vaja eksperttunnistajaid;

learning_outcomes.en: --- has knowledge of the different courts where the expert witness could appear;
learning_outcomes.et: --- omab teadmisi erinevatest kohtutest, kuhu eksperttunnistaja võidakse kutsuda;

learning_outcomes.en: --- understands the requirements of the expert witnesses' report.

description.et:
The exam will be carried out on-line, via Moodle. Student who gets overall more than 50% of the maximum score (i.e. more than 5 points out of the maximum 10) has passed the course. Time limit: 30 min.

The exam consists of two parts.
--- Part one: You will be asked to write a short answer, up to, say, 2500 characters (not strict). to a question about the course (up to 5 points, i.e. up to 50% of the overall score).

The possible questions are related to the following topics: the forensic process, the crime scene, types of work that the forensic scientist is required to carry out, class and individual characteristics, chain of custody and maintaining it throughout the process, issues around using different human tissues as samples for forensic analysis, the courts, the expert witness.

Every student will get one question. The answer has to be typed into a text box. The answer will be evaluated by the teacher.

--- Part two: Multiple choice questions (up to 5 points, i.e. up to 50% of the overall score).

Every student will randomly get four questions. Every question has one or several correct answers. Ticking right answers will give positive points, ticking wrong answers will give negative points. The questions are automatically checked by the system.
Scientific article-based presentation on the aims, methodology and outcomes followed by a Q&A session.

grade_preconditions.et: All students are admitted to the final assessment. The times of the exam will be agreed with students.

grade_evaluation.et: The student has to pass a written test without using materials (pass/fail).
